==Safety features==
==Safety features==
As a safety measure designed to prevent data loss, Windows will "freeze" the entire system if the USB drive is removed, and will continue to operate immediately if the drive is inserted in the next 60 seconds after removal. If the drive is not inserted in that time-frame, the computer will shutdown after those 60 seconds to prevent possible confidential or sensitive information being displayed on the screen or stored on [[Random-access memory|RAM]].

==Technical details==
  +
According to Microsoft, a Windows To Go drive can be created with Windows Tools like [[Windows Imaging Format#ImageX|ImageX]].
  +   +
It is planned to work on both [[USB 2.0]] and [[USB 3.0]], and both on legacy [[BIOS]] and [[UEFI]] firmware.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://techie-buzz.com/microsoft/windows-8-usb-to-go-demo.html |title=Microsoft Demonstrates Windows To Go (Run Windows 8 From USB On Any PC) |publisher=Techie-buzz.com |date= |accessdate=2011-09-16}}</ref>
  +   +
For the first time Windows boots on a particular computer, it will install the required drivers for that particular hardware and reboot. Subsquent booting operations will boot straight into Windows 8.
